content.description: Hop on either end of the boulder with the Battle of Germantown memorial plaque on it. Traverse the path of least resistance for an introductory V0ish route. Take other lines or eliminate holds for more tougher problems, or to avoid seeping mud and moss in spots. You'll get similar reactions as on the Kelly Drive Boulder since it sees a bit of foot and bike traffic.
content.protection: Nice flat ground with a low traverse for the safest landings outside a gym. Spotter moving a pad if desired.
content.location: Right next to the parking lot at the southbound Lincoln Drive pullout.

content.description: Three or so boulders with routes within 2 minutes' walk of the southbound parking lot. One set is on the rock with the "Battle of Germantown" plaque on it, next to the lot. The other two are uphill along the Lincoln Drive bike path.
